metadata.title: W3Schools.com

metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: The arc() method is used to define a circle.
content.html: The arc() method is used to define a circle.

content.text: The arc() method has the following parameters:

content.code_html:
Parameter Description
x Required. The x-coordinate of the arc's center
y Required. The y-coordinate of the arc's center
radius Required. The radius of the arc
startAngle Required. The angle where the arc starts in radians
endAngle Required. The angle where the arc ends in radians
counterclockwise Optional. A boolean value. If set to true, it draws the arc counter-clockwise between the start and end angles. The default is false (clockwise)

content.text: We can create a full circle with the arc() method by defining the startAngle as 0 and the endAngle as 2 * PI:
content.html: We can create a full circle with the arc() method by defining the startAngle as 0 and the endAngle as 2 * PI:

content.text: To draw a circle on the canvas, use the following methods:
content.html: To draw a circle on the canvas, use the following methods:

content.code:
<script>const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");

ctx.beginPath();ctx.arc(95, 50, 40, 0, 2 * Math.PI);ctx.stroke();</script>
content.code_html:
<script>
const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");

ctx.beginPath();
ctx.arc(95, 50, 40, 0, 2 * Math.PI);
ctx.stroke();
</script>

content.text: Draw a Full Circle with Colors
Add a fill-color and a stroke-color to the circle:
content.html: Add a fill-color and a stroke-color to the circle:

content.code:
<script>const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");

ctx.beginPath();ctx.arc(95, 50, 40, 0, 2 * Math.PI);ctx.fillStyle
= "red";ctx.fill();ctx.lineWidth = 4;ctx.strokeStyle = "blue";ctx.stroke();</script>
content.code_html:
<script>
const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");

ctx.beginPath();
ctx.arc(95, 50, 40, 0, 2 * Math.PI);
ctx.fillStyle = "red";
ctx.fill();
ctx.lineWidth = 4;
ctx.strokeStyle = "blue";
ctx.stroke();
</script>

content.text: Here we change the endAngle to PI (not 2 * PI):
content.html: Here we change the endAngle to PI (not 2 * PI):

content.code:
<script>const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");

ctx.beginPath();ctx.arc(95, 50, 40, 0, Math.PI);ctx.fillStyle
= "red";ctx.fill();ctx.stroke();</script>
content.code_html:
<script>
const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");

ctx.beginPath();
ctx.arc(95, 50, 40, 0, Math.PI);
ctx.fillStyle = "red";
ctx.fill();
ctx.stroke();
</script>

content.text: More About the Angles of an Arc
The following image shows some of the angles in an arc:
content.html: The following image shows some of the angles in an arc:

content.code:
<script>const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");

ctx.beginPath();ctx.arc(95, 50, 40, 0, 0.5 * Math.PI);ctx.stroke();</script>
content.code_html:
<script>
const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");

ctx.beginPath();
ctx.arc(95, 50, 40, 0, 0.5 * Math.PI);
ctx.stroke();
</script>

content.code:
<script>const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");

ctx.beginPath();ctx.arc(95, 50, 40, 0, 0.5 * Math.PI, true);ctx.stroke();</script>
content.code_html:
<script>
const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");

ctx.beginPath();
ctx.arc(95, 50, 40, 0, 0.5 * Math.PI, true);
ctx.stroke();
</script>
